cho.intro: In East Asian culture, the dog symbolizes loyalty, protection, and compassion. It has long been seen as a faithful guardian and a source of comfort and peace.
cho.passage1: The t√≤ he dog is carefully handcrafted with a charming form that fully embodies its cultural symbolism in East Asian traditions. Its upright ears and alert eyes give it a watchful look. With sleek, colorful fur, a curled tail, and a poised sitting posture, it resembles a loyal companion always ready to guard and protect its owner.
cho.passage2: People born in the Year of the Dog are sincere, dependable, and guided by a strong sense of justice. Though sometimes cautious or overly concerned, their honesty and loyalty make them a steady, trustworthy presence in the lives of others.
